revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Mercury and an Eclipse of the Moon in 1740
tldr: In this letter, John Winthrop, a professor of mathematics and astronomy, describes his observations of the transit of Mercury over the Sun on April 21, 1740, and the subsequent eclipse of the Moon on December 21, 1740. He provides detailed accounts of his observations and calculations, contributing to the understanding of celestial mechanics and astronomical phenomena.
